Theorem 4.1 characterizes relative compactness by tightness.Inorder to apply Theorem 5.1 in concrete cases,we shall in turn characterize tightness by means oftheArzela-Ascoli theorem. 
For  $x\in C$  and  $\delta>0$  the modulus of continuity is defined by 

$$
w_{x}(\delta)=\operatorname*{sup}\{|x(s)-x(t)|\,{:}0\leq s,t\leq1,|s-t|<\delta\}\,.
$$
 
Accordingto theArzela-Ascoli theorem,a set  $A$  in  $c$  has compact closure if and onlyif 

$$
\operatorname*{sup}_{x\in C}\lvert x(0)\rvert<\infty
$$
 
and 

$$
\operatorname*{lim}_{\delta\to0}\ \operatorname*{sup}_{x\in C}\ w_{x}(\delta)=0.
$$
